error.signature: Cannot start a runtime from within a runtime. This happens because a function attempted to block the current thread while the thread is being used to drive asynchronous tasks.
error.regex: Cannot start a runtime from within a runtime

verdict.summary: Nested tokio runtimes are not allowed. Calling block_on inside an async context causes this panic.

dead_ends.action: Create a new Runtime::new() inside the async function
dead_ends.why_fails: This is exactly what causes the error; nesting runtimes is forbidden

dead_ends.action: Use std::thread::spawn to run another runtime
dead_ends.why_fails: While technically works, it defeats the purpose of async and introduces complex synchronization

workarounds.action: Use tokio::spawn instead of block_on for nested async calls
workarounds.how:
// Instead of: runtime.block_on(future)
// Use: tokio::spawn(async { future.await })

workarounds.action: Use Handle::current() with spawn_blocking for sync-in-async bridges

leads_to.condition: When refactoring to spawn reveals Send bound issues

preceded_by.condition: When channel issues lead to blocking workarounds

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Connection reset is a network error; runtime shutdown is an async runtime nesting issue
